metadata.description:
I released the official production of “Grateful” a few weeks ago, and I wanted to try something new on here. First off, as a thank you to everyone who collected the first edition, you are all receiving this drop for free! And to anyone who wasn’t able to collect the official drop (*cough cough my dad*) this one is for you. This release is actually the first demo that I made of “Grateful” back in 2020. The execution of the vocal is emotional yet super raw, and the lyrics aren’t quite as locked as the official drop, but there is a magic to it that I am so in love with and I think deserves to be appreciated too. Which, of course, made me think of you all! I love the idea of web3 setting the standard for a new artist/fan/friend relationship, and I want my work here to reflect that. This drop for me represents the opening of my green-room, and a welcome to my studio, where I get to share all the mistakes along the way, all the lessons learned, and all of the fun behind writing and producing music I love. Y’all all the first to hear this version of the song, and if you feel inspired to collect it, thank you, and I appreciate you so much. Cheers to getting to know one another!

-Nico

"Grateful" is about how to ease the blush of unfamiliarity when entering a new relationship. I wrote it when I made friends with the feeling of having just enough fuel to jump AND just enough fear to shut my eyes when I do it. This song is quite a bit more specific than my previous releases. As “Stuck” talked about trusting the feeling over the circumstance, and “Paint in the Dark” described the over-arching agreements that I have observed in the healthiest love, “Grateful” exemplifies these themes using the intimacy of a pillow talk conversation. It is about putting what I’ve learned into action and trusting what happens next. 

"Grateful (Demo)"
Written by Nicolas Cyril De Luca-Verley (Nico Franc)
Produced, Mixed, and Mastered by Nicolas Cyril De Luca-Verley (Nico Franc), and Dean Woodson
With additional vocal production by AJ Jenkins

lyrics.text:
It’s the moment I take everyday just to say that I see you
And it’s the choice I make every night to lay next to you
Cause all the while I know
Things like this don’t last long do they

Although I fear an end I won’t forget the beginning
Like a flash in the rain you hit and I knew I was willing to jump
You were the perfect excuse to jump

So regardless of what’s next for us
Know that I am grateful just to love you
Just to love you
Once told myself that it would hurt
But you showed me that love can work without a bruise
I guess I’m just grateful for you

So let’s cheers off the night with a bottle of wine to forgiveness
And read the summary pages of all our past relationships
Just to laugh god I love it when you laugh

So regardless of what’s next for us
Know that I am grateful just to love you
Just to love you
Once told myself that it would hurt 
But you showed me that love can work
Without a bruise
I guess I’m just grateful for you
Grateful for you my love

If you ever feel alone sometimes
You can call me I am yours to remind

That regardless of what’s next for us
Know that someone’s grateful just to love you
Just to love
I told myself that it would hurt
But you showed me that love can work without a bruise
I guess I’m just grateful for you
I’m so grateful for you
Grateful to love you
Guess I’m just grateful to love you
